moves.9. b4: my first choice, as it is the most efficient way to show that white intends to attack.
moves.9... Nh5 10. Re1 Nf4 11. Bxf4: i consider this move as a positive move, as black knight has already moved three times and was much more aggressive than my bishop.
moves.11... exf4 12. Rc1 a5 13. b5: white has definitely more space and the only weakness (e4) is not in real danger
moves.13... b6 14. Qd2: attacking the pawn; let's eat what's on the menu
moves.14... f5: opening the game, but the computer considers it as an inaccuracy
moves.15. Qxf4 fxe4 16. Qxe4: black is now with the advantage of an open column. But white has lost his weakness and is a pawn ahead.
moves.16... Nf5 17. Bd3: this move was supposed to give some air to the queen.
moves.17... Bd7 18. Qe2: the computer does not say anything, here, but considers white loses its 0,50 advantage.
moves.18... Qf6: not quite sure this attack is valuable. the computer sees it as an inaccuracy again.
moves.20... Qa3 21. Rb1 Rae8 22. Rb3: though I saw this move as the completing one to enclose the queen, the computer does not give me a real advantage.
moves.22... Qa4 23. g4: Mistake! the computer sees it well, but not wwgia. He could have played Ng3, followed by 24. hxg3, then Bxg4 recuperates the piece and win 2 pawns.
moves.23... Nd4 24. Nxd4 Bxd4 25. Qd1: mistake, according to the computer, but i am not convinced by his reasoning.
moves.25... Rf4 26. h3 Ref8: the best according to the computer was here to take the knight and the bishop for a rook.
moves.27. Kg2 h5 28. gxh5 g5: probably the computer proposed the best solution as playing Bf5, threatening many things.
moves.29. h6: the computer consider this as a mistake. Once again, its line is not convincing and he avoids my next move h7+ which i considered since the beginning of my attack, here. This may be the best shot of this game, if I can say that.
moves.29... g4 30. h7+: I think this is decisive. I don't think king can take, as it exposes itself to a check "à la découverte", with a direct threat on the d7 bishop.
moves.30... Kh8 31. h4: i think this was the right move to play: avoiding more threat on the g column by refusing the g4 offer...
moves.32... Rf8f4: the computer proposes instead Bf5. It would eliminate a good defensor, but is it the thing to do?
moves.33... Rh3: this is of course a tragic mistake, but i am not sure Bf5 -again- can save the day.
